treatment.description: Strongly suggesting no. 91, doming, arching or sprawling; primocanes with numerous hard broad-based hooked prickles 3-4.5 mm. long, mixed with relatively few or no bristles and glands; primocane-foliage coriaceous, dark green, lustrous, 3- or 5-foliolate; the obovate to suborbicular leaflets abruptly tipped, coarsely toothed; terminal leaflet 3-8 cm. long, 2.5-5.5 cm. broad, the midrib beneath armed with hooked prickles, the prickly petiolule 0.5-2 cm. long; raceme interrupted, simple or paniculate, 0.6-3.2 dm. long; the axis and pedicels densely pilose, usually much armed, sometimes glandular; pedicels 1.5-4 cm. long; calyx prickly or unarmed, its lobes ascending in fruit; petals spatulate, 7-11 mm. long, 4-8 mm, broad; fruit globose, small. (Incl. R. provincialis, vigoratus, Bicknellii and mananensis Bailey)
